title: If you frame champ balance like this, stop talking about champ balance
body:
{{champion:99}} 

Q: It's a Morgana Q that hits 2 people

W: It's a Sona W that shields everyone twice

E: It's a Morgana W that does all of its damage at one time

R: It's an Ezreal ult that doesn't reduce in damage for hitting 5382 minions and doesn't go from fountain to fountain

Yeah, these make the foundation of the most bullshit posts I see on these boards. If you frame your argument like this, politely log off the forums until you have a better argument.

Because their kits are not the exact same, and even if one literally had copies of every ability with additional effects, that Champion's ability numbers and base stats could be tuned.

That's... proof that he had a point.

Your notion that it's just a matter of tweaking numbers is extremely disingenuous and demonstrably incorrect in practice. It's not like Lux or Morgana are new champions. They have had numbers tweaks for years and years at this point.

Morgana being such an ancient champion design, it really shouldn't surprise anyone that her kit just objectively sucks right now.

The only reason she doesn't have a worse win/loss rate than LeBlanc is because she's longer range and has a Black Shield. Absolutely everything else about Morgana is literally a crippling weakness for her team if you picked her insead of any other champion.

The problem is that very few people actually go into details. Example:

> â€” A's Q deals twice as much damage as B's Q! Broken!
â€” Yes, But A's Q has a lesser range, a higher CD, a smaller hitbox, a longer cast time and is colliding instead of pass-through.
â€” Yeah, but it deals twice as much damage!

And that is just comparing spell by spell, but there is also the concept of power budget, and most people don't understand that.

Agreed. Listing a champion's strengths without mentioning their weaknesses or conditions, or comparing them to another champion without bringing up the potential advantages the latter has over the former, makes for a severely incomplete and very obviously biased analysis. It is also one of the most frequently used templates for low-effort upvote farm posts, and I think it continues to be one of the major reasons why Gameplay isn't taken seriously at large. We can do better than that, and many of us do, but as long as we continue to allow ourselves into this facile mode of argumentation, we're not going to be nearly as credible as we can be, or deserve to be.

To be fair, her ultimate has only its shorter-than-some-basic-abilities windup as a weakness, andcompensates that with a 20 second cooldown and the biggest area of effect of any damaging ability in the game.
